snippet.title: Teenager bags second place in pro junior event in US
snippet.content: SURFING: Moffat Beach's Reef Heazlewood has snared second spot at a pro junior event in California. The teenager won his four-competitor semi-final and was right in the hunt in the four-rider final at the Vans US Open of Surfing. He finished with 14.93 points, just behind Hawaii's Cody Young (15.46). Heazlewood made a late charge, chasing a wave score of 8.63, but just fell short. It's another promising performance from the reigning Australasian Pro Junior champion, who will compete at the junior world championships in New South Wales early next year. For Young, the victory was a breakthrough, "To win this event in my last year as a pro junior is the best thing ever," he told World Surf League. "This is my first major win of my career so far. I'm just so stoked on this right now. "This will give me a lot of confidence going to the back half of the year and especially trying to get back to the world junior championships since all these guys are there. "I'm looking forward to the rest of this year and hopefully carry this momentum into Kiama next year."
